items.text: I manage a chronic condition that requires daily medication and monitoring.
items.rationale: Directly references chronic disease management, a core health domain concern.

items.text: My physical health has significantly declined over the past year.
items.rationale: Describes a trajectory of physical health status, central to the Health factor.

items.text: I frequently experience pain that limits what I can do during the day.
items.rationale: Chronic pain and functional limitation are primary health-related concerns.

items.text: I have a family history of serious medical conditions that concerns me.
items.rationale: Family medical history and genetic health risk are squarely within the Health factor.

items.text: I take an active role in attending medical appointments and following up on test results.
items.rationale: Health-seeking behavior and engagement with medical care are core Health indicators.

items.text: My energy levels are consistently low, and I suspect it is related to an underlying health issue.
items.rationale: Fatigue attributed to a medical cause is a direct health status indicator.

items.text: I have been diagnosed with a condition that affects my mobility.
items.rationale: A diagnosed mobility-affecting condition is a clear biomedical health concern.

items.text: I am currently recovering from a major surgery.
items.rationale: Post-surgical recovery is an unambiguous health status descriptor.

items.text: I struggle with a weakened immune system and get sick more often than most people.
items.rationale: Immune function and illness frequency are direct physiological health markers.

items.text: My doctor has told me that my blood pressure and cholesterol are at concerning levels.
items.rationale: Clinical biomarkers communicated by a physician are quintessential Health factor content.

items.text: I have difficulty sleeping due to a medical condition rather than stress or worry.
items.rationale: Sleep disruption attributed to a medical etiology maps clearly to Health over Psychological Characteristics.

items.text: I rely on assistive devices like glasses, hearing aids, or a cane to function day to day.
items.rationale: Use of assistive devices reflects functional health status and physical impairment.

items.text: I often feel physically exhausted even when I haven't been particularly active or stressed.
items.rationale: Unexplained fatigue likely maps to Health but could also reflect psychological burnout.

items.text: I find it hard to keep up with others physically, which makes me withdraw from group activities.
items.rationale: Physical limitation is Health-related, but social withdrawal introduces Social Factors ambiguity.

items.text: I have changed my diet and exercise routine because my doctor recommended it for a health condition.
items.rationale: The medical motivation is Health, but diet and exercise changes overlap with Lifestyle behaviors.

items.text: I prioritize getting regular exercise as part of my weekly routine.
items.rationale: Regular exercise habits are a prototypical lifestyle behavior pattern.

items.text: I pay close attention to what I eat and try to maintain a balanced diet.
items.rationale: Dietary choices and nutritional awareness are core lifestyle factors.

items.text: I make a conscious effort to maintain a healthy work-life balance.
items.rationale: Work-life balance is a central lifestyle management concern.

items.text: I avoid smoking, excessive drinking, and other habits I consider harmful.
items.rationale: Substance avoidance is a key health-related lifestyle behavior.

items.text: I have a consistent daily routine that includes time for self-care activities.
items.rationale: Structured self-care routines are hallmark lifestyle organization behaviors.

items.text: I spend a significant amount of my free time on hobbies and recreational activities.
items.rationale: Leisure and recreation patterns are core lifestyle descriptors.

items.text: I tend to stay up late and have an irregular sleep schedule by choice.
items.rationale: Voluntary sleep patterns and circadian preferences are lifestyle behaviors.

items.text: I prefer to cook meals at home rather than eat out or order takeaway.
items.rationale: Food preparation habits are everyday lifestyle choices.

items.text: I regularly set aside time for relaxation practices like meditation or yoga.
items.rationale: Deliberate relaxation practices are proactive lifestyle wellness behaviors.

items.text: My living environment is organized and designed to support my well-being.
items.rationale: Environmental organization for well-being reflects intentional lifestyle design.

items.text: I limit my screen time and try to be intentional about how I use technology.
items.rationale: Technology use management is a contemporary lifestyle behavior.

items.text: I enjoy spending time outdoors and make nature activities a regular part of my life.
items.rationale: Outdoor recreation habits are lifestyle activity patterns.

items.text: I have recently made significant changes to my daily habits to improve how I feel overall.
items.rationale: Habit change is Lifestyle, but 'how I feel' introduces possible Psychological Characteristics overlap.

items.text: I find that my daily routine is heavily influenced by the people I live with.
items.rationale: Daily routine is Lifestyle, but the social influence component introduces Social Factors ambiguity.

items.text: I use alcohol or other substances recreationally as a way to unwind and cope with pressure.
items.rationale: Substance use is a lifestyle behavior, but using it to cope suggests Psychological Characteristics (coping style).

items.text: People who know me well would describe me as someone with strong personal values.
items.rationale: Core personal values are a defining feature of the Person factor in holistic models.

items.text: My sense of identity is something I have thought deeply about throughout my life.
items.rationale: Identity formation and self-concept are central Person factor constructs.

items.text: I have a clear sense of who I am, regardless of the situation I am in.
items.rationale: Stable self-identity across contexts is a core Person factor attribute.

items.text: My cultural background plays an important role in shaping who I am as a person.
items.rationale: Cultural identity as a component of selfhood is a Person factor element.

items.text: I consider my spiritual or religious beliefs to be a fundamental part of my identity.
items.rationale: Spiritual identity and belief systems are core Person factor descriptors.

items.text: My life experiences have shaped me into a fundamentally different person than I was ten years ago.
items.rationale: Personal growth and biographical narrative are central to the Person factor.

items.text: I have a strong sense of personal agency — I believe I am the author of my own life.
items.rationale: Personal agency and self-determination are key Person factor constructs.

items.text: My gender identity is an important part of how I understand and express myself.
items.rationale: Gender identity as a dimension of selfhood is a Person factor element.

items.text: I am someone who has overcome significant adversity, and that defines a lot of who I am.
items.rationale: Narrative identity shaped by adversity is a Person factor construct.

items.text: My personal ethics guide my decisions more than external rules or expectations.
items.rationale: Internalized moral framework as a guide for behavior is a Person factor attribute.

items.text: I feel that my age and the generation I belong to have significantly shaped my worldview.
items.rationale: Generational and developmental identity are Person factor components.

items.text: I have a strong connection to my heritage and the traditions I was raised with.
items.rationale: Heritage and tradition as identity anchors are core Person factor content.

items.text: I sometimes struggle to reconcile different aspects of my identity, such as my professional self and my personal self.
items.rationale: Identity conflict is Person-related, but the struggle could also reflect Psychological Characteristics.

items.text: The roles I play in my family — as a parent, sibling, or child — are central to who I am.
items.rationale: Family roles as identity are Person-related, but the relational aspect introduces Social Factors ambiguity.

items.text: I define myself largely through my relationships with others.
items.rationale: Self-definition is Person, but the relational basis of identity overlaps with Social Factors.

items.text: I tend to experience emotions more intensely than most people around me.
items.rationale: Emotional intensity and affective reactivity are core psychological characteristics.

items.text: I have been told that I have a tendency to overthink things and ruminate on problems.
items.rationale: Rumination and cognitive style are prototypical psychological characteristics.

items.text: I generally feel confident in my ability to handle whatever challenges come my way.
items.rationale: Self-efficacy is a well-established psychological characteristic.

items.text: I have a diagnosed mental health condition that affects my daily functioning.
items.rationale: Mental health diagnosis and its functional impact are central psychological characteristics.

items.text: I find it very difficult to regulate my emotions when I am under stress.
items.rationale: Emotion regulation capacity is a core psychological characteristic.

items.text: I am naturally optimistic and tend to expect positive outcomes even in difficult situations.
items.rationale: Dispositional optimism is a well-documented psychological characteristic.

items.text: I have high levels of motivation and drive to achieve my goals.
items.rationale: Achievement motivation is a fundamental psychological characteristic.

items.text: I often experience anxiety that seems disproportionate to the actual situation.
items.rationale: Trait anxiety and disproportionate worry are core psychological characteristics.

items.text: I am highly self-aware and spend a lot of time reflecting on my thoughts and feelings.
items.rationale: Self-awareness and introspection are key psychological characteristics.

items.text: I have strong cognitive abilities and pick up new concepts quickly.
items.rationale: Cognitive ability and learning capacity are psychological characteristics.

items.text: I tend to be impulsive and act before fully thinking through the consequences.
items.rationale: Impulsivity is a well-established psychological characteristic with behavioral implications.

items.text: I have a resilient mindset and bounce back relatively quickly from setbacks.
items.rationale: Psychological resilience is a core psychological characteristic.

items.text: I notice that my mood fluctuates significantly depending on how well I have been sleeping and eating.
items.rationale: Mood fluctuation is psychological, but the lifestyle triggers introduce Lifestyle/Health ambiguity.

items.text: I find that my mental state improves dramatically when I have meaningful social contact.
items.rationale: Mental state is psychological, but the social trigger introduces Social Factors ambiguity.

items.text: I experience persistent low mood that I believe is connected to my lack of social support.
items.rationale: Low mood is a psychological characteristic, but the attributed cause is social isolation, overlapping with Social Factors.

items.text: I have a strong and supportive network of friends and family I can rely on.
items.rationale: Social support networks are a prototypical social factor.

items.text: I often feel isolated and disconnected from the people around me.
items.rationale: Social isolation and disconnection are core social factor concerns.

items.text: My socioeconomic status has a significant impact on the opportunities available to me.
items.rationale: Socioeconomic status and its impact on opportunity are fundamental social factors.

items.text: I am actively involved in my local community through volunteering or civic participation.
items.rationale: Community engagement and civic participation are core social factor behaviors.

items.text: I have experienced discrimination or prejudice that has affected my well-being.
items.rationale: Experiences of discrimination are social determinants with well-being implications.

items.text: The quality of my close relationships has a major influence on my overall life satisfaction.
items.rationale: Relationship quality and its impact on satisfaction are central social factors.

items.text: I live in an environment where I feel safe and supported by my neighbors.
items.rationale: Neighborhood safety and social cohesion are established social environmental factors.

items.text: I have access to good healthcare, education, and other essential services in my area.
items.rationale: Access to services and social infrastructure are key social determinants.

items.text: I feel a strong sense of belonging to a group or community that shares my values.
items.rationale: Sense of belonging and community identification are core social factors.

items.text: Financial stress is one of the biggest challenges I face in my daily life.
items.rationale: Financial stress as a social determinant is a well-established social factor.

items.text: I have people in my life who genuinely understand and accept me for who I am.
items.rationale: Perceived social acceptance and understanding are core social support factors.

items.text: My work environment is collaborative and I feel respected by my colleagues.
items.rationale: Workplace social climate and collegial respect are occupational social factors.

items.text: I find that being part of a social group motivates me to maintain healthier habits.
items.rationale: Social motivation is a social factor, but the health behavior outcome introduces Lifestyle ambiguity.

items.text: I tend to take on a caregiving role in my relationships, which can be both fulfilling and draining.
items.rationale: Caregiving is a social role, but the emotional impact introduces Psychological Characteristics ambiguity.

items.text: My social circle strongly influences the kind of person I see myself as.
items.rationale: Social influence is a social factor, but self-concept formation overlaps with the Person factor.
